title: Why do I lag when I stream with OBS?
body:
CPU: AMD FX-8350 4.0GHz 8-Core Processor
- w/ Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO 82.9 CFM Sleeve Bearing CPU Cooler

GPU: EVGA GeForce GTX 750 Ti 2GB FTW ACX

Motherboard: Gigabyte GA-970A-UD3P ATX AM3+

RAM: 8gbs

Upload Speed: 4.43 Mbps
- 16 ping/66.32Mbps download speed

Monitor Resolution: 2560 x 1080
- Set OBS to 1920x1080

I usually have 47-50ms when playing but I have 60-200ms when I stream. Anyone know what is wrong? Max bitrate and buffer are set to 3000 but even lowering it to 2000 didn't change anything.

replies.body: Your network might not be strong enough to maintain streaming, but it could also be a settings issue with OBS.  In regards to connection, the only thing I can really suggest is to make sure you are running a wired connection.  The [OBS community](https://obsproject.com/forum/categories/obs-support.37/) might be able to help tune up your settings and troubleshoot this.  I hope that helps!

Streaming will have an impact on your ping when you play. How much impact depends on the program you're using.

You can try to [Troubleshoot your connectivity issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to see if it helps though.
